channel.title: CSCT Conference 2019 : Flow
channel.description: Recent content on CSCT Conference 2019 : Flow

item.title: Venue
item.description:
Venue 2019 This year the Arnolfini plays host to the CSCT Conference, a hub for contemporary art and creativity.
Arnolfini is located in the centre of Bristol on Narrow Quay, between the harbourside and Prince Street.
Address 16 Narrow Quay Bristol BS1 4QA
On Foot From the south, cross the swing bridge from Prince Street. From the north or centre of the city, walk along the quayside leaving the centre.

item.title: Research Centre and Groups
item.description: Research Centre and Groups The Computer Science and Creative Technologies Conference 2019 is hosted by a collection of its constituting research centres and groups from The University of the West of England. Computer Science Research Centre The Computer Science Research Centre (CSRC) is comprised of active researchers based at UWE, covering a range of disciplines across the field of computer science. The CSRC groups these areas into the following core themes which reflect the work of many of its members.

item.title: Special
item.description: Special Performance We are anouncing a very special performance soon… Check back or follow UWE’s CSCT twitter for updates: Follow @UWE_CSCT

item.title: Program
item.description: Flow - 2019 Time Presenter Title Type Length 09:45 Tim Brailsford (HoD) Welcome Opening 15 minutes 10:00 Rebecca Fiebrink Using Data and Machine Learning to Support Human Creative Practices Keynote 50 minutes Session 1 10:50 Chris Nash Musical Platforms: Patterns and Chaos in Music Talk 1 20 minutes 11:10 Frazer Barnes Printed sensors and how they will revolutionize the food supply chain and reduce waste Talk 2 20 minutes 11:30 Break Break Break 30 minutes Session 2 12:00 Kevin Doyle Institute of Coding Highlight 15 minutes 12:15 Phil Legg, Jim Smith, and Richard Preen HASTE - Human-centric active-learning for decision support in threat exploration Talk 3 20 minutes 12:35 Tom Mitchell Interactive Sonification of Molecular Physics (Isomorph): Making the Invisible Audible Talk 4 20 minutes 13:00 Lunch Lunch Lunch 60 minutes 13:00 Ben G and Steve Battle Programming with potatoes Workshop 60 minutes 13:00 Multiple Posters Posters 60 minutes 14:15 Teresa Dillon In Your Aerial Keynote 45 minutes Session 3 15:00 Dom Brown Designing an Immersive Musical Experience in Virtual Reality Talk 4 20 minutes 15:20 Luke Reed Immersive Audio in Cinematic VR Talk 6 20 minutes 15:40 Liz Lane Performance 1 20 minutes 16:00 Break Break Break 60 minutes 17:00 Imogen Heap Performance 2 Performance 60 minutes

item.description: Registration Follow @UWE_CSCT -- To register click here or fill out the form below.

item.title: Keynotes
item.description: Dr. Rebecca Fiebrink Dr Rebecca Fiebrink is currently a Senior Lecturer in Computing at Goldsmiths, University of London. She is the original creator of Wekinator, an open source software project that allows users to build new interactive systems by demonstrating human actions and matching them to computer responses, instead of writing code. Accompanied by her students and research assistants, Fiebrink works on projects that develop technologies that enable new forms of human expression, creativity, and embodied interaction.
